name: Bone Dance "Snakecharmers" T-shirt
description: Printed on Anvil tees These were released exclusively for the USA pressing of "Snakecharmers" vinyl. Once they are gone, they are gone forever. RIP Bone Dance.

name: Tempest - "Solace" 7"
description: Black vinyl, first pressing Crusty, dark, Canadian black metal at it's finest. This record goes down like expensive whiskey; smooth but with punch, fire, and bite. "Solace" is enveloping and atmospheric, building tiers of gloom and heaviness for an oppressing landscape that blends together in a surprisingly elegant way. This is a criminally underrated band and record. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zgy5Wzs4doI

name: Adult Books - s/t 7"
description: First pressing; black vinyl Adult Books 7", 4 songs of power-poppy, Ramonesy, Marked Men-ish radicality. Coming from a different angle than their Los Angeles rock and roll contemporaries in that they can actually tune their guitars, play their instruments, and write killer songs, this three piece has been playing around for some time and shares one member with Children of God. Check this out, 400 press.

name: Melotov "Olive logo" BEANIES - Black & Grey
description: Minimalist logo for elitist attitudes. "Those who know, know". Show off your love of aggressive music while simultaneously keeping your head warm and your style fresh. Pic 2: As modeled by myself and youngest brother

name: MLTVR013 - The Banner "Born to Ruin part I: The Way is Shut" Cassette
description: 300 pressed; first pressing. Comes with download code The first new release from The Banner in 5 years. Cursed with line up changes, crashed hard drives, and a multitude of maladies, the New Jersey devils themselves successfully channelled their struggles into their darkest release yet. First of a four part demo release, it only seemed appropriate to press this on a cassette. There will be no repressing of this demo tape. Get it while it's hot. Tracklisting: 1. Wolvesblood 2. Lilith 3. Negative Zone 4. Night (Zola Jesus cover)

name: Calculator "This Will Come to Pass" LP
description: Black vinyl out of 350; first press; comes with insert This is the first full length from the California quintet that consists of entirely new music (unlike "Roots", which is a compilation of 2008 - 2010 and you can purchase here). Touted by Brooklyn Vegan as "raw, honest, and uncompromising...similar to fellow Cali bands Touche Amore or the now-defunct Comadre", This Will Come to Pass blends notes of darker, brooding melodies with upbeat and uptempo rhythm, perfectly crafting that Calculator sound we love oh so much.

name: MLTVR022 - Bone Dance "SNAKECHARMERS" 12" EP
description: 200 dank green/smoke haze, 300 gold single-sided 12"; digital download This repress offers completely new artwork, new vinyl colorways, and a special limited edition t-shirt package (see picture 2). Released in 2010 and out of print shortly thereafter, "Snakecharmers" was the EP that put Bone Dance on the map amongst the great ranks such as Gaza, Coalesce, or Engineer. Self-described as "utter, desert-driven nihilism" the quintet from Boise, Idaho deliver a relentless barrage of start/stop grindy, mathy, hardcore chaos and don't let up. Ever. Pick up one of the pre-order packages below: - Green/smoke haze $10.99 - Green/smoke haze w/ "Rats" t-shirt $18.99

name: MLTVR005 - Calculator "These Roots Grow Deep" 2ND PRESS
description: New artwork; pressing out of 500 on white vinyl This is the 2nd pressing of Calculator's "These Roots Grow Deep" discography LP released in 2010 and OOP since mid-2011. Ultra rare and "Kali", this LP fast-tracked the California natives into the booming post-hardcore takeover that gave rise to bands like Loma Prieta and Comadre. First 50 pre-orders hand numbered! All white vinyl exclusive to this repress.

name: MLTVR021 - Old Wounds/Trenchfoot s/t split 7"
description: 150 purple; 350 black; digital download w/ insert. 1st pressing. Combo of both colors only $8! This is a pre-order for a split seven-inch featuring two ferocious young East Coast hardcore prospects: Old Wounds and Trenchfoot. Taking their cues from metallic hardcore greats like Turmoil, Buried Alive, and Indecision, Old Wounds inject new life into the crushing, exhilarating vibe once wielded by that older generation of bands. Pitchfork.com described Old Wounds' debut as "lashing ahead at a furious hardcore clip... [it] pairs the maudlin pages of high school diaries with a grown-ass band's concision and power." From upstate New York's Hudson Valley, Trenchfoot are another awesome young band carrying forth the metallic hardcore power of their older brothers' era into a new realm. Their dark, heavy sound nods to the manic depression of Cursed and the epic crust of Tragedy, and they have cut their teeth in the past two years playing with every hardcore band that matters, from Agnostic Front to Converge. LISTEN TO A NEW OLD WOUNDS & TRENCHFOOT SONG STREAMING OVER AT CVLT NATION: http://www.cvltnation.com/old-wounds-trenchfoot-stream/

name: The Hope Conspiracy - "Death Knows Your Name" LP
description: 1st press on black vinyl (only printed on black vinyl); digital download; Deathwish The recording session was engineered by Kurt Ballou (Converge) at Godcity Studios. These release (and the "Hang Your Cross" 7"EP) marked the first recorded appearance of Tim Cossar (American Nightmare, Bars) with the band, as well as the return of guitarist Neeraj Kane (The Suicide File, "Cold Blue" era guitarist) back to the song writing fold. The "Death Knows Your Name" full length is a stark and mesmerizing chapter in The Hope Conspiracy legacy. From the haunting first notes of "They Know Not", to the earth shaking "Stolen Days", the unforgiving heaviness and rage of the album are both awe inspiring. The songs lunge and writhe with immeasurable emotion and turmoil like all great art does. Serving as a true amalgamation of their classic piss and vinegar approach and a new found epic maturity.

name: Life Long Tragedy - "Runaways" LP
description: Gatefold jacket, Cream/black mixed vinyl; digital download; Deathwish Over a year in the making, "Runaways" captures the raw beauty that weeps from the core of Life Long Tragedy. Songs like "The Bottomless Hole" and "Hey Death" showcase their bold growth, finding confidence at slower tempos and in more open song writing than their contemporaries. While "Youth" and "Ignoring Lessons" race forth with the rabid rebellious energy that Life Long Tragedy have been previously been known for. All of this is complimented by some of the most heart wrenching lyrics and crude melodies in recent memory. All together, these qualities make "Runaways" an infectious effort that will be championed my many for years to come.

name: Loma Prieta - "I.V." LP
description: 1st press on black vinyl; digital download. Deathwish For “I.V.” the band’s Deathwish debut, Loma Prieta once again worked with longtime collaborator Jack Shirley (Atomic Garden Studio). Written during a time of great personal suffering and transition for the band "I.V." is the creative culmination of those collective experiences. From the opening breath of “Fly by Night”, Loma Prieta crash and bang melody and discord together into one beautiful work of art. This grinding theme continues throughout "I.V." in stunning songs like the aptly named three parter "Trilogy 4, 5, and 6". Creating a powerful and unpredictable ebb and flow to their emotional outpouring. As the dust settles on the distorted haze in closer "Diamond Tooth", an artistic coherency and clarity emerges that can only be described as Loma Prieta. A new kind of melancholy chaos that should be familiar, yet challenging, to those who enjoy bands like Love Lost But Not Forgotten, Pg. 99, La Quiete, and the ilk.

name: Incendiary/Xibalba - s/t split 7"
description: Red marble vinyl; digital download. Closed Casket Activities East meets West in this split 7" of NY's INCENDIARY and CA's XIBALBA. Both bands bring forth two new songs that are easily their best material to date. This split acts as sign of what is to come on both bands upcoming full lengths in 2012. Be on the look out for more info on an LP from INCENDIARY this year on Closed Casket Activities as well as an LP from Xibalba this Spring on Southern Lord Records entitled "Hasta La Muerta". All copies come with a free digital download TRACK LISTING: 01. Incendiary - Survival 02. Incendiary - Rome Is Burning 03. Xibalba - Stone Heart 04. Xibalba - Fuck You Pelon

name: Heiress - "Early Frost" LP
description: 1st press on opaque green vinyl; digital download. Deathwish "Early Frost" by Heiress is a grim and discordant artistic journey into the cold soul of the Pacific Northwest. Recorded by renowned engineer Jack Endino (Nirvana, Seaweed, etc), "Early Frost" opens with the airy post-everything beast "All Ruins" and immediately sets an ominous tone. Wasting no time, Heiress then dive deep into the awe inducing title track "Early Frost". A beautifully haunting song filled with delicate melody and hair raising emotion. Songs like the unforgettable "Beyond Fevering" and eery "Splintering" continue this sonic exploration, experimenting with cryptic vocal stylings before unfurling true sonic power. All of first level observations aside, what is so refreshing is just how non-metal and unpredictable Heiress are, while they carry such a foreboding collective soul. Heiress melodiously twist when other artists would predictably turn up the volume. For example in the stunning track "Again, Before" Heiress masterfully introduce a pan flute, where other artists would inject a stereotypical guitar solo. After nine mesmerizing tracks, we are led through the darkness to the epic closer "Bolt and Tomb", a song which opens with thirty seconds of hypnotic percussion, building to a crescendo of truly glacial proportions. "Early Frost" from Heiress is an essential experience for those who are searching for substance in today's heavy music world.

name: Graf Orlock "Los Angeles" 7"
description: 2nd pressing, poster. Vitriol Records This is the most mind-numbing incarnation of Gorlock, true to form, and a rigid adherence to the annoying doctrine of cinemagrind, this 7" rages through four tracks in 10 minutes (curiously the same running time as the 6 Doombox tracks). Complete with requisite "source information", these songs are faster, more complete, and believe it or not, more pissed. This EP ventures further into the "character study" of Los Angeles, focusing on themes as diverse as stilted relationships, getting robbed, and shooting the shit out of downtown for 11 unimpeded minutes, while simultaneously encapsulating the disgusting culture of the mid-90s. This comes with an insert featuring lyrics and some great artwork courtesy Alan Hunter. There are 600 copies of this bastard, broken down into three different covers. The covers will have actual me-shot bullets holes in them, so technically, each is a 1/1 because even though i have ridiculously accurate and tight firing patterns, no two are the same. For you wieners trolling discogs, they are all black vinyl. Adieu The Poster is 14"x21" with all of your favorite characters from Heat.

name: HOAX "Collected" LP
description:
Buzz-saw guitars, bludgeoning drums, and breakdowns that scream "kiss me on my bloody head". they are the defenders of true hardcore spite and genuine danger. Mosh-heavy songs of empowerment and anger are forged using a degraded distillation of vintage Alan Blake-style riffing backed with driving, militaristic drums, and the feral anomie typically reserved for a vocalist like Mike IX Williams.

This LP is compiled of Hoax's 3 7"s, their side of the split with Sewn Leather, and their s/t tape.

name: MLTVR020 - Globe and Beast "Grandfather's Axe" LP
description: 150 opaque oxblood/bone, 350 black vinyl; insert; digital download; first pressing "Noisy, sinewy, mathy, violent, metallic hardcore with heart and soul, wrapped in tire irons and dipped in battery acid." - Decibel Magazine "Anthemic hardcore shrouded in gloom..." - Revolver "Globe and Beast are in full attack mode on their new album titled Grandfather's Axe... Explosive." - Cvlt Nation "one seriously pissed-off and heavy album" - Rock n Reel Reviews On "Grandfather's Axe", the young San Diego quintet churn out anthemic hardcore, shrouded in gloom. Theirs is a unique combination of vibes: the aggressive meets the dissonant, the crushing meets the dismal. Somewhere between the frontal assault of Buried Alive and the spiraling depression of Kiss It Goodbye or Cursed, songs lurch forward like a wall of black storm clouds devouring all in their path. What makes it thrilling is not only the destructive power but the ominous mood.

name: MLTVR019 - Capacities "There is No Neutral" 10"
description: 1st pressing out of 500. 100 smoke/coke bottle, 400 white, digital download, and insert. Melotov Records (US), Dog Knights Productions (UK) Capacities hails from New Jersey, a state known for hurricanes, "beat down" hardcore, and guidos. But what the Garden State is criminally lesser known for is the solid list of disjointed post-punk bands that paved a way for that hip internet term, "skramz". Sincere and unapologetic, Capacities is a four-piece hardcore band featuring members of Black Kites, You And I, and The Saddest Landscape. They present their own style of aggressive emotional hardcore that separates them without compromising their relevance. With songs entering and exiting close to the one-minute mark, their debut 10", "There is No Neutral", is sure to shine a different light on what New Jersey is capable of producing.

name: Dangers - s/t 7"
description: First pressing, black vinyl, Vitriol Records Originally released in 2005 this 7" garnered some face punchings and much shit talking. Check it out. 600 press.

name: Comadre - s/t LP
description: Gatefold jacket with 12" x 12" color booklet; 180 gram clear vinyl, First press. Vitriol Records 12 new songs from Comadre, who have not released a proper full length since 2006 (although have been quite busy with a slew of other releases.) This new LP contains the song "Cold Rain" from the previous 7" single as well as 11 other songs pretty sure to impress people and throw some for a loop with their new found go-for-it attitude. Check this thing out.

name: Breaking Rad T-shirt
description:
Meth, cancer, chemistry, and hardcore all wrapped into one dinky t-shirt that we'll probably be sued over for usage of Walter White's image. 

EXTREMELY LIMITED. Only 20 printed due to the aforementioned threat of a lawsuit. Punk, right?

name: MLTVR018 - Nomads/Treacherouskin "Violent Fucking World" split 7"
description: First pressing; 150 red vinyl, 350 black vinyl. This is a PRE-ORDER please allow 2-3 weeks for shipping "...white knuckle, vitriolic, vicious hardcore." - tighttothenail.com Searing crust punk thrashers, NOMADS, melt the wax with head-banging, metal/hardcore crossovers, TREACHEROUSKIN on "Violent Fucking World". With both bands featuring hardcore veterans from Minority Unit, Sleepwalkers, and Spitting Teeth, this split makes for the most abrasive 45rpms of the year. Both bands offer up their own interpretation of aggressive, violent hardcore, and with inmate meticulousness, carefully manipulate it into a blunt force instrument. In other words, this is the vinyl-shiv to end them all. Prepare to be stabbed with finesse comparable to Nails, or Dead in the Dirt, or Entombed. It is a violent fucking world, after all.

name: Cowards - "Shooting Blanks and Pills" LP
description: First pressing on black vinyl out of 300; hand numbered; printed innersleeve; Throatruiner Records "Gathering parisians with an already strong pedigree in dark and heavy music, COWARDS regurgitates gutter hardcore, unhealthy sludge/doom and nauseous black metal in “Shooting Blanks And Pills”, their deeply raw and anxiogenic debut release. Only six months were needed to give birth to this full-length, monstrosity with a desperate urban feeling, bridge between the knife-in-the-heart crudeness of Eyehategod or Kickback and the majestic darkness of bands like Deathspell Omega or Thou. With a sound carrying smells of pissy streets and the dry blood you get for a sidelong glance, producer Francis Caste have perfectly catched the gist of these 38 minutes, recreating this forced apnea in a bile tank with a no frills approach."

name: Direwolves - "Me From Myself, To Banish" 12"
description: First pressing out of 500 on clear vinyl; inserts; printed jacket; Throatruiner Records "Hailing from Lorient (western France), DIREWOLVES merge modern hardcore, crust and screamo on their debut EP "Me From Myself, To Banish". These six songs find the perfect balance between emotion and heaviness, reminding of bands such as Alpinist, Lewd Acts or Killing The Dream." DIREWOLVES is a monolithic construction of sound and potential. This EP promises big things for this band. And you know what they say about France... Birds in Row came from there so it must be good. Listen below. Be impressed.

name: Discourse - s/t 7"
description: Black vinyl out of 500, black vinyl, digital download, Bitter Melody Records Hard-hitting from the first chord strike, Discourse had me hooked from the guttural grunt of anguish 10 seconds into the first track. To call it "high octane" sounds cheesy, but this band is relentless in their execution of heavy, violent hardcore. Now on Mayfly Records, the s/t 7" reminds me of other Mayfly alumni like Incendiary, and Suburban Scum, but maintain their originality. Expect to see this band every where, this is a record that is going to blow up big.

name: Indecision - "Unorthodox" LP
description: 1st pressing, white/clear out of 356. Digital Download, Bitter Melody Records The NYHC classic record, "Unorthodox" is the perfect title for being the founding father of the metal/hardcore crossover. Not strictly hardcore, and not strictly metal, the searing guitars, harsh screeching vocals, coupled with the background heavy chugs and thrashy drumming, help make INDECISION one of the pioneering bands for greats like Curl Up and Die, and His Hero is Gone. Brash and metallic, this record is an obvious must-have.

name: Old Flings - "Spite" LP
description: Pressing out of 500. First Press. Insert, digital download. Bitter Melody Records Drawing (bold) comparisons to Texas is the Reason and Dinosaur Jr., Old Flings presents a post-pop-punk-emo-alternative-90s-revival Frankenstein of a record that is both monstrous in sound and tame in nature. A gentle giant of LPs, "Spite" contains all the great things about 90s alt-rock without getting caught up in the past and dying out quick. If you like the driving, yet melodic guitars of Jawbreaker, and the relaxed and comforting vocals of Cave In, this record is a must. It's easy to fall in love with this LP and band by the second song, "Merry Go Round". Definitely worth a listen!

name: Heart to Heart - s/t LP
description: Black/Green vinyl out of 300, first pressing, digital download, Anchor 84 Records California's own, HEART TO HEART, are an on-the-rise post-pop-punk band awash with gentle melodies and heartfelt, honest lyrics. With their melancholy approach to all things melodic hardcore, the quintent (which features the homie, Taylor Stillwell on guitar. Hi Taylor!) recall the musical stylings of Make Do and Mend & Bayside. And that's not to say it mimics those two bands, but rather reinvents the genre and delivers a record with a start-to-finish playability.

name: You & I - "Saturday's Cab Ride Home" LP
description: Repress of the original on black, white, and clear vinyl; printed insert; How Soon is Now Records For the post-hardcore enthusiast, you cannot exclude You & I from the list of influential greats. "Saturday's Cab Ride Home" is the legendary first album by this NJ powerhouse that practically melts the wax with it's searing pg.99-meets-Sunny Day Real Estate vocals and white-hot melodies. And when this record gets heavy, it gets HEAVY. Once described as an "emo version of Unbroken & Converge", You & I break screamo and hardcore barriers to deliver an LP that makes it clear why they are revered name in this chaotic and disjointed hardcore community. Fans of Touche Amore and La Dispute should be listening to this!

name: Capacities - "The Unexamined Life" LP
description: 1st pressing of 300; purple/brown vinyl with etched b-side; digital download; printed insert; How Soon is Now Records Capacities is the genius concoction of members from Black Kites, The Saddest Landscape, Less Life and more. The disjointed, post-punk supergroup delivers a chaotic, cathartic, thrashy and heavy cacophony that straddles the line between bands like Orchid, Neil Perry and Portraits Of Past. This LP is the precursor to the Capacities 10" due this winter on Melotov Records! Listen here: http://capacitiesnj.bandcamp.com/album/the-unexamined-life

name: Less Life "Today Will Be Ours" LP
description: 1st pressing of 500 on yellow, smoke, and green; printed insert; How Soon is Now Records Less Life is a 3 piece hardcore band from New Jersey. It's sort of like if Takaru, Deadguy, Botch and Tragedy all got mixed up in a smoothie with some soy milk. Ex and current members of black kites, the assistant, this ship will sink, youandi, write back soon and more. Pressing info: 20 - Test Press 105 - YELLOW 161 - CLEAR/BLACK Swirl 261 - CLEAR GREEN

name: Weak Teeth "What a Plague You Are" LP
description: 12" black vinyl; printed insert; digital download; Flannel Gurl Records "Nothing that's special can ever die" is the last line in the opening song, which seems to serve as a disclaimer that was paraphrased from "You'll be sad when listening to this, but remember to embrace that despair and turn it back on the world". At least it seems that's what Rhode Island's Weak Teeth did. Weak Teeth are self-described as "emo-damaged hardcore", which is fairly appropriate. Melodic, but pissed-as-fuck, this LP charges headlong into the swell and crest of monolithic waves that drag you through the undertoe of post-hardcore. The ebb and flow doesn't cease until the needle scratches the label on the B-Side. "What a Plague You Are" is mentally punishing, and the masochist in all of us will truly appreciate that.

name: City Cop - "Seasons" LP
description: Single-sided LP with etched B side; yellow vinyl; printed insert. Flannel Gurl Records Opening with a song-version of Bukowski's "Blue Bird", CityCop set the stunning, melancholy, and ethereal tone of this 12 inch piece of wax from the first chord strike. Using an acoustic guitar as their prominent instrument while all other instruments are "plugged-in", the Ohio quartet craft some of the most unique, heartfelt, raw, and elemental post-whatever in the current [insert sub-genre here] scene. Not chaotic and "sad" enough to be called strictly screamo, but not shouty and driving enough to be called hardcore, CityCop fit comfortably between post-punk and experimental indie brilliance. If you'd like to cleanse your pallet between courses of that Rites of Spring repress and the new Code Orange Kids LP, then "Seasons" is the perfect sorbet to your sonic feast. A little trivia: This record was almost a Melotov Records release, but then I ran out of money. So order it.

name: MLTVR017 BONE DANCE - s/t LP
description: 500, first pressing. 150 pink/clear, 350 clear. Full color printed inner sleeve. Digital download. Bone Dance takes the grime and gravelly glut of the band’s previous work, the self-released Snakecharmers, and reevaluates not only its intensity, but also the band’s heritage: retooling the ferocity of hardcore, the technical acumen of extreme metal, and the minimal gauze of sludge and doom. This is the kind of tight, controlled, anvil-heavy music that only comes out of an area dominated by the Religious Right, the Conservative Coalition, and some of the most culturally repressive mechanisms in America. With a desert-driven nihilism, the band proves yet again that the frontier isn’t innovation—the frontier is misery.

name: Capacities/Coma Regalia s/t split 7"
description: Choice of Gold vinyl or black vinyl; lyrical insert; hand numbered; Middle Man Records The most intense, disjointed, thrashy post-hardcore you can squeeze into 45rpms. Featuring members of You and I, Black Kites, and The Saddest Landscape, it's no surprise that Capacities comes in with guns a-blazin' and dominates this 7". On the flip side (literally), Coma Regalia breaks the "skramz" mold with a 5 minute epic that bursts through the wax with all the elements of a perfectly executed screamo B-side. Keep your eyes peeled for the Capacities 10" this fall out on Melotov. Pic 1 cover art, Pic 2 whole package.

name: MLTVR016 - GHOSTLIMB "Confluence" LP
description: Die-cut "G" on jacket, lyrical insert sleeve, digital download included. 150 black vinyl, 850 white vinyl. 1st press This record is the second in a trilogy from Ghostlimb, starting with last year's "Infrastructure" LP. As a whole, this is the 5th Ghostlimb release to date. Confluence takes up where this leaves off and moves the discourse about varying scrutinized topics along with bravado and jerkiness. This LP has 11 new songs, ranging from regional politics, those piece of shit kids you grew up with, political theory, and ecology. Also featured is a cover of Hot Water Music's "Southeast First". Thrashy, unapologetic, and melodic at parts, "Confluence" is the musically mature sophomore release in this three part piss offery. this is a split release between Vitriol and Melotov records.

name: Great Reversals - s/t split with They Come in Waves
description: Digital download code; lyrical insert Great Reversals, drawing inspiration from bands like Trial and Bane, meld dense riffs, soaring melody, raw emotion, and reflective lyrics with hopes of replicating the spirit of 90s hardcore that is the foundation for their sound. Located in Detroit, Michigan they have been playing regularly since late 2009, opening for national acts such as Agnostic Front, Mother of Mercy, Foundation, Defeater, Former Thieves, Another Breath, and Run With The Hunted.

name: Great Reversals "To The Ends of the Earth" 10"
description: Blue Vinyl; lyrical insert; first pressing It's too easy to describe a somewhat-melodic hardcore band as "passionate", "emotive", and "hard hitting", but Great Reversals is the epitome of all, in the truest definitions of the word. With massive 90s hardcore influences, Trial and Bane, coursing through this 10", Great Reversals differentiate themselves from the hordes of hardcore bands with the empathetic, intensely raw, and vulnerable lyrics "To The Ends of the Earth" has to offer. Lyrically centered on their drummer's struggle to raise his deaf, autistic son, this LP offers tracks that are the personification of angst, grief, hope, and perseverance amidst dismal circumstances. It's pummeling, unrelentless, and cathartic. One of the best hardcore records we've heard in a long, long while.

name: Hexsis - "Septus/Fatum" 7"
description: Clear smoke swirl vinyl; Monotonstudio Records Dortmund Germany's HEXSIS kick your fucking teeth in with this 7". The A-Side track, "Septus" opens with explosive drumming and relentless alternate (speed) picking and then prolongs the brutality by lulling the listener into an eerie, briefly melodic comfort. The guitar runs on "Fatum" could be on a Slayer B-side, and just pummels the living hell out of you. The refreshing element is that each song is not lost on one genre, and the vocals are unicore. There's not enough black metal parts to call Hexsis strictly black metal; there's not enough disjointed percussion to call it skramz; there's not enough sludgey break downs to call it hardcore. "Septus/Fatum" is a healthy mix of each, and instead of feeling like it's a lost direction, they pull it off flawlessly.

name: MLTVR015 - VICES "The Out Crowd Blues" 7"
description: 450 pressed; 150 transparent blue, 300 black vinyl; insert; first 75 orders get FREE Melotov shirt Straight out of the marshlands of Florida comes the powerhouse that is Vices. Riffy, bluesy, hardcore that would make Muddy Waters stage dive to, "The Out Crowd Blues" has been compared to Sabertooth Zombie, All Teeth, and Mountain Man, and there is something raw and relatable in Daniel Strickland's lyrics that is perfectly supported by guitarist Shane Kelley's pentatonic chops. This 7" is an energetic, slightly melodic, angry force to be reckoned with. First 75 orders get a free Melotov shirt! Leave your shirt size in the comment section of PayPal when you place your order. International orders, please e-mail: mbvprez@melotovrecords.com ***There was an issue at the plant and they made all 150 colored vinyls transparent blue instead of blue/black. We're sorry if you were looking forward to that particular color. Transparent blue is still pretty rad***

name: MLTVR014 - THE BANNER "Each Breath Haunted" LP
description: First press, first time on vinyl. 333 pressed; picture disc, gatefold LP. Artwork insert included. Bonus track included on digital download. ***TWO lucky pre-orderers will get a test press of EBH!*** The record that broke the mold for NJ hardcore is now on vinyl for the first time. 1. Devil Hawks 2. Venom And Hope 3. I'll Be Happy When You're Dead 4. An Allergy To Sun 5. Sovereign Of The Black Pit 6. Black Hoods 7. An Allergy To Silver 8. Hell On A Horse 9. Interlude 10. Mud Dweller 11. Coffin Nails 12. Tragedy 13. Bonus track on digital download International orders, please e-mail Melanie with any discrepancies. mbvprez@melotovrecords.com

name: Ghostlimb - "Infrastructure" LP
description: Die cut jacket with embossing on back; 350 gsm cardstock; printed inner sleeve; 1st press on standard black vinyl, digital download included, Vitriol Records This is the first record in what is soon to be a trilogy of Ghostlimb piss-offery. Politically, ecologically, and socially charged, "Infrastructure" is more or less a metaphor for the edifice of irrationality and blatant stupidity that we've built upon shakey ground. Thrashy and melodic, this LP challenges you to examine things with an extremely critical eye, and then fucking rage. Personal favorite song on this record is "Asphalt" which is a testament to the hindsight bias of personal sacrifice in times of hardship. The record closes out with a cover of "Plastic Surgery" by Leatherface, a sarcastic balance -- a palette cleanser -- to the sheer disgust and anger in the previous 11 songs.

name: Dangers - "Anger" 12" repress
description: 2nd pressing on Transparent blue vinyl out of 700 This is the first full-length release from the "pissed-ass pedestrian punk" band, Dangers. Don't let the repressing on beautiful blue vinyl fool you, this LP is anything but inviting. The intense hatred contained within all twelve little inches of this vinyl are enough to leave you angry for days (hence the name) or broken hearted by the harsh realities exposed by front man, Al Brown. Either way, broken hearts beat just fine, and this record is a testament to that; the heart behind the hate is lovable and easy to stand behind, and is, without a doubt, still beating.

name: Dangers - "Messy, Isn't It?" LP
description: 12" red vinyl, fold out poster. 3rd press The 2nd full length release from hardcore favorites, DANGERS, is more tongue-in-cheek spiteful than their straight forward first LP "Anger." Not traditionally hardcore, and not traditionally punk, Dangers are a band that cannot be pidgeon-holed into any specific genre of hardcore music. They are, "simply," a batch of angry intellectuals playing aggressive and punishing music. As Vitriol Records themselves put it, "Messy, Isn't It?" is "all of your worst nightmares about what music could be, rolled into the sarcastic and menially insightful form of 18 songs." This much anticipated release is quickly becoming a staple in hardcore/punk libraries nationwide, and it's not hard to understand why.

name: Birds in Row - "Collected" LP
description: Repress of "Rise of the Phoenix" 7" & "Cottbus" 10" LP; Die-cut jacket; black vinyl; Printed inner sleeve with lyrics; Vitriol Records Birds in Row is a colossally heavy and melodically passionate band that cannot be pigeonholed as strictly "screamo" or "hardcore." These Laval, France natives deliver a distinct and mature sound; they've fleshed out and perfected the art of torment & despair through enveloping, punishing, and frantic rhythms and vocals that are not to be overshadowed by the melodious, sad, and in a way, human instrumentals.

name: Griever - "Inferior" 10"
description: 1st press, White vinyl; UV Spot varnish on gatefold jacket; Vitriol Records This is the first release from the San Diego area's Griever. Former members of Lewd Acts take on a new direction of drony, sludgey, melodic heaviness. Better yet, imagine if the collective Lewd Acts smoked hash with Baroness; the result is "Inferior". This 10" is 4 songs, equating to a solid 20 minutes of musical opium. And if the drug references don't make any sense to you, Griever can also be described as blurring the line between stoner metal and post hardcore. Try before you buy:

name: Iron Age - "The Sleeping Eye" gatefold LP
description: Gatefold full color jacket; black vinyl; digital download; Tee Pee Records Iron Age's "The Sleeping Eye" is a sprawling modern heavy metal opus that doesn't forsake its hardcore roots, but follows them to their sonic extremities, forging a sound that honors the crossover forefathers while treading new ground in brutal atmosphere and doomy ambiance.

name: Lizards Have Personalities/Adaje - s/t split 7"
description: Black vinyl; Carucage Records, Sea of Tranquility Records, Sometimes I Get Drunk Records In the hazy skyline of the undefined cross streets of post-hardcore and skramz, residents Adaje and Lizards Have Personalities fatefully cross paths at a hole-in-the-wall coffee shop, dimly lit by outside street lamps. Inside, they drink their coffee (black, of course) and pretend to find solace in each other's woes, but as they drop a few crumpled dollars on the table for tip and go their separate ways, both continue to wallow in misery. Hate your life too, with this split 7".

name: MLTVR011 - CALCULATOR "New Forms" 7"
description: 666 pressed, 166 pressings on black vinyl, 167 white, & 333 clear. Random order will get FREE test press of this record. All orders come with Melotov buttons and bottle-opener. Recorded at Atomic Garden by Comadre's own Jack Shirley, "New Forms" is the matured follow up 7" to Calculator's discography LP "These Roots Grow Deep". Get all three colors for only $12! Release break-down: 666 Total---------------------- 166 black -- 66 pre-order editions 167 white -- 67 tour edition 333 clear -- 10 S&F edition (sold out) The special editions can be found at http://calc.bigcartel.com Each of the special editions will come with a photo print on the cover, hand numbered jacket, and a patch.

name: MLTVR007 - TIDEMOUTH "What I Meant to Say" 7" EP
description: 500 pressed; 200 white, 300 clear; digital download included w/ bonus track; exclusive Sound and Fury test presses for three lucky pre-orderers. Package deal: Get both white and clear vinyl for $10! With influences that range from Modern Life is War, AFI, Orchid, and The Cure, it's difficult to confine Tidemouth to one specific genre. Too pained & instrumentally dynamic to be strictly hardcore, yet too heavy and eerily atmospheric to fall under the category of "90s screamo," this EP is caught in a purgatory between melodic angst and crushing sadness. Listen here:

name: Graf Orlock "Doombox" 10" + Trilogy CD
description: Record jacket assembles into boombox; CD with whole Graf Orlock discography, including "Doombox"; Clear vinyl Taken from Vitriol Record's website: "Alright. Finally this piece of shit is out, featuring a 10" worth of new material based on the complexities of urban disparity, and a CD containing the Doombox 10" songs plus the last three trilogy records. This, I shit you not, is 42 songs of Gorlock madness spanning the last 4 years of mindless wandering through the cinemagrind ether. If you care to look at the image, this comes in a handsome foldout boombox, completing a new staple to your bedroom feng shui, and guaranteeing that you misunderstand what this thing will really look like. The two pressings are black (150 preorders) and clear (1350 standard press). "

name: Gracer/Lady Fantastic - s/t 7" split
description: Baby Blue vinyl; hand numbered jackets; Limited to 500; I Am Shark Records Released on LP/EP Records, this split 7″ is on baby blue vinyl features songs from 2 different bands that have moved them. Our very own GRACER presents the powerful track "Telephone Lines" alongside the Ohio native artist, Lady Fantastic. Each vinyl comes hand-numbered with original silk-screened sleeve and 6 mil bag. Limited pressing of 500.

name: Damages / Book of Caverns - split 7"
description: Black vinyl, digital download included, React! Records/Clue Number 2 Records Vancouver's Damages open up this 7" with the driving, menacing and almost threatening track "Suppression Therapy". Tinged with Refused-inspired guitar runs and bass tones reminiscent of hardcore favorites, Shellac, pinpointing Damages sound is a difficult task. It's somewhere between 90s hardcore and post-hardcore, but regardless of how you try to pidgeon-hole this band, this A side is relentless and Damages is unapologetic about it. Edmonton's Book of Caverns (Clue #2 Records) deliver an organic, atmospheric, and subdued single on this B side, almost as an homage to Pianos Become the Teeth, or some other instrumentally-clean and vocally passionate post-hardcore band. And although the melancholy resonates on their portion of wax through strained cries and background screams, Book of Caverns is a band you can definitely bring home to "mom"... If your mom is La Dispute, or Touche Amore.

name: Departures - "Green Turns to Red, Then Turns to Gold" 7"
description: Clear vinyl, Fist in the Air Records Dropping the needle on this clear piece of wax instantly pushes you into the throes of melancholy. The opening track, "Those Miles Meant Everything" carries through with a slightly pop-punky riff that builds an unconscious sense of hope throughout the song only to be washed away at the 2 minute mark by a wave of melodic gloom. The B-side track, "Fuck Living with Sadness", is more traditional hardcore in the vein of Verse, or Have Heart. Departures from across the pond in Scotland is doing great things. Don't sleep on this record.

name: Old Wounds - "Terror Eyes" 7"
description: 300 pressed; 200 white, 100 gold. Digital Download included; RDG Records Blackened, snarling, thrashy, unrelentless. That's "Terror Eyes" in four words. This EP moves quick, you'll be bedroom moshing at the first needle drop. This metal-tinged hardcore band from New Jersey will have you scouring for your Slayer shirt and shot-gunning beers just like the glory days. But in all seriousness, Old Wounds tears into you and doesn't let go. This is one hell of a ride.

name: Lester Freamon - "Natural Police" 7"
description: 500 pressed; 100 grey, 400 black; Digital Download included; Radical Friends Collective & Moment of Collapse Las Vegas is known for all the "Fear and Loathing" and "Hangover" cliches, but what it really is beginning to be known for is its wealth of fantastic post-hardcore/screamo efforts such as Caravels (Top Shelf), and now Lester Freamon. "Natural Police" is a debut EP from this Vegas band and brings in 14 minutes what bands with many releases under their belts hope to deliver in a career's worth of time. This band is not one to pass up on. Technical, delivering, emotive, driving, and passionate, Lester Freamon is soon to be a staple in any hardcore collection.

name: Jowls/The Reptilian - s/t split 7"
description: 5 different jacket covers featuring portraits of members of Jowls and The Reptilian; black vinyl; split release from Mayfly Records and The Ghost is Clear Records Two of Michigan's finest, Jowls and The Reptilian have come together for the first time on this incredible release. Jowls, a Cave In-meets-Botch two piece band brings the heavy on the A side of this 7", while The Reptilian counters with a more mellow approach reminiscent of Native and Seahaven. This sale is the first pressing of this release, 500 pressed on recycled black. There are 5 seperate covers all limited to 100, collect them all!

name: Native - "We Delete; Erase"
description: 500 repressed on coke bottle blue and clear with red/black splatter; all new original artwork; digital download code; The Ghost is Clear Records Melodic hardcore tinged with some skramzy charm makes for a powerhouse of a band. Enter, NATIVE, the instrumentally inclined, lyrically astounding, and passionately profound 4-piece from Indiana. Touring with the likes of La Dispute and Former Thieves, the indie/punk band has made their home in the ever-expanding universe of progressive hardcore. For fans of a wide spectrum of musical genius from Who Calls So Loud to Xerxes. Don't sleep on this record.

name: Reivers - "Schemata" 7"
description: Stamped black vinyl; offset press jackets; Vitriol Records The first 7" release from this Oakland, CA band featuring members of Graf Orlock and Acts of Sedition. Female fronted hardcore that FINALLY isn't just powerviolence. Combine the punky-hardcore vibes of Suicide File and the gritty brutality of Rise and Fall. For only $4, you can't afford to not check this out.

name: Cowboys are Indians - "Constantly Fucked" LP
description: Lyrical insert; black vinyl; Bear Records Melodic hardcore is too much of a generic, blanket term, bringing to mind the kings of this genre: Mordern Life is War, Verse, Sinking Ships, Defeater etc. Emotional Hardcore generally insinuates screamo with less skramz percussion and more distinguished vocals i.e. Touche Amore and Pianos Become the Teeth. So how do you be both without being none of the above? Melodic but not mellow; urgent and frantic, but not skramzy; emotive but not emo, Cowboys are Indians are both melodic and emotional hardcore without sacrificing a harder or darker tonality. Taking the best elements of both genres, CAI blend the two perfectly into a concoction that is equal parts heavy and atmospheric. Hardcore kids won't feel like a pussy for liking it, and screamo lovers won't think it's too "tuff" and ignorant. Think an American Birds in Row.

name: Versions/Dead Man s/t split 7"
description: Red transparent vinyl; digital download; hand screened jackets Death-y, Doom-y crust punks, DEAD MAN, take on Botch-y, progressive, sludge masters, VERSIONS, for 14 minutes of bludgeoning heaviness. Oakland isn't just for gangsters, skramz, and The Raiders anymore...

name: At Both Ends Zine w/ 2x7" feat. Bane, Unrestrained, Between Earth and Sky, & more)
description: Included is one 148-page magazine/book that compiles two new issues worth of At Both Ends Magazine and two 7” records with songs from Bane, Grade, Unrestrained (Portland, Oregon) and Between Earth And Sky (members of Trial, By A Thread, Catharsis, Walls Of Jericho). All recordings are exclusive to this release. In the magazine are articles and interviews with Bane, Sick of it All, Verse, Shook Ones, Bill Stevenson, Sparkmarker, Anchor, Shai Hulud, Greg Bennick, Devotion, Wait In Vain, To Kill and a ton more stuff. This is about as packed as a zine can get. The magazine is perfect bound with glossy pages and color covers. Printing is similar to a book and is higher quality than pretty much any commercial magazine you would find in a store.

name: Broadway Calls s/t CD
description: Courtesy of State of Mind Records A CD of good pop-punk (i.e. Bayside, Banner Pilot, Cobra Skulls, etc.), and is sure to steer clear of the generalized Y2K pop-punk of yore.

name: Living Eyes - "Starve for Agony" 7"
description: FIRST PRESSING; Clear vinyl; digital download Four losers make good after multiple stints in the septic tank that is modern U.S. punk/hardcore. Members of Ceremony, Look Back and Laugh, Punch, Talk is Poison, Skin Like Iron, Loma Prieta, Rely, Dead and Gone, California Love, etc. Nods to early North American primitive hardcore and UK punk stone carvings. Oakland. TRACK LISTING: 01. Occupational Hazard 02. Oblivion 03. God Country 04. Starve For Agony 05. Heathen Blood 06. Hatemaker 07. No Shame 08. Resist

name: Jackals/No Coast s/t split 7"
description: Pressing of 300 on blue/purple swirl vinyl (side-A) and transparent vinyl on side B; digital download; Dog Knights Productions (UK) From Dog Knights: "If you like bands such as Swing Kids, Das Oath, (old) Daughters, you should definitely check out No Coast! Jackals are back again with 3 more awesome tracks of pissed-off hardcore punk, including a Dead Kennedys cover. All copies are on blue vinyl with purple mix, with high quality fold-over covers. The colours have come out pretty crazy. Side A has the blue/purple mix, but side B is entirely purple."

name: Jackals/Self Loathing s/t split 7"
description: 500 pressed - 100 black vinyl, 400 clear; black-and-white 8x11 poster insert; Dog Knights Productions (UK) Jackals is what you get if Ross from Ceremony fronted G.B.H. Self Loathing is caught in the crossfire of the powerviolence of Weekend Nachos and metal-tinged-hardcore of Mammoth Grinder. Overall, a uniquely satisfying hardcore punk listening experience. Break out your patched-up, studded, black denim vest, tight black jeans, and go act tough.

name: MELOTOV T-SHIRTS!
description:
Artwork by Dylan Smith; 150 printed on Gildan t-shirts

Printed by straight-edge vegan artist extraordinaire, Dylan Smith, these shirts were printed exclusively for Sound & Fury 2011 (hence the black and green color scheme). Printed by the wonderful Hellfish Family, please support both them and Dylan. Dylan Smith
Hellfish

name: The Gentle Art of Chokin' - s/t LP
description: Black jacket with UV spot varnish (black on black on black), black vinyl; 420 black vinyl German powerviolence grindy goodness. Think Ed Gein (the band) meets Ceremony meets Weekend Nachos and then is stabbed to death by Graf Orlock. Chaotic, punishing, angry, and unrelenting, The Gentle Art of Chokin' is soon to be household name in any fastcore enthusiast's collection.

name: Buyer's Remorse "A Thorough Analysis" 7" EP
description: Clear vinyl w/ cut insert This record is rock 'n roll as fuck. Up the punx with the Buyer's Remorse "A Thorough Analysis"-- a head-banging combination of some Hour of the Wolf and Hot Snakes flair mixed with the snarling attitude of LA skate punks. In a nutshell, Buyer's Remorse is the long-overdue grandchild of Agent Orange. Listen and hear why:

name: MLTVR010 - Beau Navire "Life Moves" LP
description: Pressing of 500, North American copies limited to 135; single-sided black vinyl, lyrics etched onto B-Side; full-color gloss poster; one lucky pre-order will get a FREE TEST PRESS; ships with Melotov buttons and bottle opener; split label release with Moment of Collapse (Germany) & Shove Records (Italy). Featuring members of IWroteHaikusAboutCannabilismInYourYearbook, and Loma Prieta, you'd expect nothing less from the super (skramz) group that is Beau Navire. "Life Moves" is a full-length epic that moves poetically and chaotically, but never loses sight of itself. In other words, it's purpose is not just to sound discordantly pretty, or aesthetically technical, but to evoke the same cathartic passion from the listener as the band itself clearly emits. Disjointed, frantic, melodic, haunting and atmospheric, Beau Navire have taken the blue-print for 90s screamo and breathed new life into it. For fans of all your favorite skramz bands, i.e. Funeral Diner, Pageninetynine, Ampere, Loma Prieta, etc. This Record goes great with a glass of red wine or Calculator's "These Roots Grow Deep."

name: Phoenix Bodies - "Too Much Information" CD+DVD
description: First pressing of 500; CD has 37 songs, collecting the split CD/LP with ENKEPHALIN, the song from the Slave Union 2x7" compilation, their split 7"s with TYRANNY OF SHAW, SHIKARI, RAEIN, and THE DREAM AS DEAD as well as a full live set from Dude Fest 2004 and the original 7-song demo. DVD has live sets from Dude Fest 2004, Summerslam 2004, and a mini interview with the band 37 songs of unbridled hatred and sarcasm, Phoenix Bodies' "Too Much Information," is a math-meets-grindcore wet dream. Snotty, snarling, and spitting vocals are accompanied by the instrumental finesse of the likes of math/grind virtuosos Dillinger Escape Plan, Graf Orlock, and Botch. This record greets listeners with a matured "up the punx" attitude and latches itself onto your frontal lobe, relentlessly sucking and draining you of any logic to the point where all you can do to help yourself is smash things and rage in general. In other words, this is the perfect CD to be playing while sitting in gridlock.

name: Who Needs Maps? - s/t 12" LP
description:
French screamo at it's very best. DIY all the way, up until their latest release which Shove Records put out. Think Comadre meets latest hardcore wet dream, Deafheaven.

I've exhausted my resources for trying to find more information on this band, so I'll leave you with their myspace URL. All I know is that if you like what you hear, take a gamble.

www.myspace.com/whoneedsmaps

name: MLTVR008 - Residuals "Grief" CD EP
description: 1st pressing of 1000; all orders include Melotov button and bottle opener Chronicling the death of guitarist/vocalist Ray Libby's father, "Grief" is 8 tracks of melodic, heartfelt, and sorrowful mid-tempo hardcore. Although only an EP, Residuals give equal attention to detail for each song, allowing each track to fully develop; you aren't left feeling like something's missing. And, aside from the intricate guitar work, passionate and tight drumming, and relatable yet uniquely individual lyrics, the best part of "Grief" is that the album swells like rough waters at high tide, and crash into the shoreline, dragging the listener into an undertow of cathartic release and bittersweet climax. Prepare yourself for an inevitably painful introspection followed by wounded resignation. Pensive, dark, and honestly raw, Residuals summarize their own release with a line from the song "Despair..." nothing else matters, nothing else is sadder than being here. Dual release with Radical Friends.

name: Zann - "Three Years in the Desert" CD
description:
After tons of split releases with Funeral Diner, Racebannon, Anger is Beautiful, Blame Game their own 7" and discography CD - this is their first full length with 6 songs (28 minutes). The new record is so far the best recorded material by this band which sometimes let me think on all those good old brutal German bands ala Acme, Loxiran and so on. 

If you want your hardcore varied, volcanic and intense, independent not only in theory but also in practice, with thoughtful, socially aware lyrics, then Zann is your thing. Going strong since 1999, the five Germans epitomize all that made punk an important counterculture in the first place. Infusing an insightful political substance to their luminous musicianship, they clearly stand out as one of Germany's best contemporary hardcore purveyors. Both formats come on recyled paper with lyrics and explanations about their songs.

name: Glasses - s/t LP
description: Single-sided LP; etched B-side; includes CD of entire album What do you expect from a band consisting of people who bring in their experience from bands like 244 GL, Trainwreck, Perth Express and The F.A.? Damn right - a monster of dark and brutal rocking hardcore punk, razorsharp breaks, hyperprecise drumming and an angry female singer that you would not want to get an argument with. This is going to be the new supergroup of German hardcore - don't miss your chance to be there in the beginning! Also, if you like this, check out their 2x7" split with Comadre (thanks, Vitriol Records), also in the e-store.

name: This is Hell - s/t 12"
description: One-sided LP w/ etched B-Side; 650 black, 100 grey Pleading, heartfelt, angry, and relentless, This is Hell's self titled LP is a punishing one-sided record. Each of it's 6 tracks places you directly in the eye of their emotional storm, and refuses to let go until the needle lifts. This album is for fans of The Carrier, Comeback Kid, Ruiner, and American Nightmare.

name: Dead Hearts - "Death in the Family" 7"
description: Mix of purple, white, and black vinyl; includes digi-download of all 11 tracks In September of 2008, DEAD HEARTS played their last show. At that show they released a portion of their last recording session as “A Death in the Family” ep. This 3 song cdep was pressed only once, limited to 100 copies and sold out at that show. Later they went back and finished up one last track to release this, the last 4 recorded songs by DEAD HEARTS. This four song 7” comes with 11 track digital download that includes “All Good Things Must End”(live @ cbgb‘s) & “A Death in the Family”. Art work by Matt Warfield most recently did the art for ANOTHER BREATH “The God Complex”

name: Decades - "Numbered" CD
description: From the confused and scattered cities that comprise the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex comes unconventional hardcore/punk outfit, Decades. Their debut EP, "Numbered," clocks in at roughly 25 minutes with six songs of melodic, distinct and thoughtful hardcore centered around introverted musings of identity crisis, mortal anxiety and social discontent. "Numbered" crosses more lines and covers a much wider array of emotion than your average EP ever attempts to.

name: Reviver - "Potential Wasteland" CD
description:
REVIVER, from Salt Lake City, is the best current melodic hardcore at the moment. In the vein of Modern Life is War, American Nightmare, Ruiner, and Refused, Reviver appropriately breathe life into dark, experimental post-punk. If that hasn't convinced you that this is the best $5 you'll ever spend, "Potential Wasteland" also features guest vocals from Derek of DEFEATER.

Formed in 2007 they have self-booked over 10 full tours and have covered the entire U.S. several times. They will be on tour most of the year so you can’t miss them. www.myspace.com/reviverhc

name: MLTVR009 - CANYONS/TIGON/FOREIGN THEATERS 3-way split LP "Can't Have Nothin' Nice"
description: 100 recycled black vinyl, 500 total pressed, comes with artwork and lyrical insert, free digital download. First 50 Melotov orders include a "grab bag of swag." This is a split label-release with Mayfly Records & The Ghost is Clear Records. Released 11/30/2010 From the hot-boxed catacombs of mathcore-meets-stoner-metal, comes the heaviest 3-way split this year from Missouri's Canyons and Foreign Theaters, and the Bay Area's Tigon. Sharing influences that range from Coalesce and Kylesa to Black Sabbath and The Melvins, these three "math-sludge" virtuosos deliver a formidable testament to how grimey, raw, and technical the recesses of hardcore can go. Although all three bands wrote and recorded the record independently of each other, "Can't Have Nothin' Nice" shares a common theme of the flaws of the human-condition, and calls for a serious self-evaluation through rigorous (and often ruthless) introspection. For fans of Coalesce, Engineer, The Jesus Lizard, Botch, and brutality.

name: MLTVR003 - Dance For Destruction "When Color Was Real" 12" LP
description: "When Color Was Real" was given a limited run of 100 sky blue vinyl and 400 black. Free test pressings with your order while supplies last! Sacramento, CA's Dance For Destruction are a hardcore electro-punk band in the vein of Punch, Homesick Abortions, and Bikini Kill on steroids. Their debut LP, "When Color Was Real," is a sonic assault of dual guitars, driving bass and intense drumming, circle pits and break downs, and vocals that tear through the layers with female-fronted fury. Dance For Destruction leave no stone unturned with background synthesizers in songs like "True Beauty Lies Inside," acoustic stylings on "Surrender," and gang vocals on "Fuck Materialism." These diverse elements make D4D a formidable force to be reckoned with, and leave behind an unprecedented wreckage in the wake of their live performances.

name: MLTVR004 - Cathedrals/Bleeding Kansas s/t split 12"
description:
500 Clear vinyl w/ custom dual fold jacket that turns into poster
Metallic doom-punks, Cathedrals, meet Breather Resist-inspired Southern groove masters, Bleeding Kansas, for a 12" split that'll trample you with brutality while simultaneously lulling you into the heavy vibes of true Southern Comfort. Cathedrals blends sludgey, savage, and analog with a violent clarity to create a cut throat tone that gives "post-hardcore" a run for its money. Bleeding Kansas counters those primal urges with submersive, complex riffs that pulse through the grooves in the vinyl, taking drunken swings at those who stumble their way. This yin and yang release is for fans of Botch, Cursed, Coalesce, Trap Them, and Jim Beam.

name: MLTVR006 - DEADHEAD s/t 10"
description: Matte/gloss black jacket with black vinyl and black labels, insert artwork by Clayton Stevens On their darkest release yet, DEADHEAD explore all avenues of despair, self-loathing, insanity, fear, and sacrilege with painstaking guttural fervor. Their crusty, evil, and down-right angry barrage on side A is pitted against the massive riffage and epic end tracks on Side B, and the black-on-black-on-black artwork is only a precursor to how dark this album truly is. Featuring 3/5 of Touche Amore (Jeremy, Clayton, and Tyler), Jake of Bleeding Kansas, and Eric of Restrained, this musical cast is not only talented lyrically, but musically sound and creative; this is not your typical naysayer-crust-punk band. Deadhead's self-titled release is not for the light hearted, but as it clocks in at just more than ten minutes, it's a record you'll have to (and want to) play over and over again. Picture 2 is the insert artwork

name: Cathedrals/Deadhead - s/t split 7"
description:
Transparent Blue vinyl, digital download card
Guttural, crusty, and evil, Deadhead(featuring members of Touche Amore) take on the sludge-punk kings, Cathedrals (featuring members of Bleeding Kansas), on this heavy and doom-laden split. Both bands are featured members of Melotov and Mayfly Records; a perfect clash-of-the-titans release.

name: Comadre/Glasses - s/t split 2x7"
description: Double 7" on heavy vinyl (70-gram), black and blue swirl, 12 page full-color booklet (see pic. 2) From Vitriol Records: This is Comadre's 6th release and Glasses' 2nd, with both bands following up one-sided LPs released last year. If Comadre's "A Wolf Ticket" had been a full length, these songs would have rounded out the release. Glasses delivers the most pulverising, rock 'n' roll-ing-est hardcore that has ever been played in drop-C tuning. Track Listing: COMADRE: the sweeter the juice; byrne'ing down the haus; count basie box set; living differently?! GLASSES: Tigers; So Right; Lydia.

name: Wait in Vain - "Seasons" 12" LP
description: Light blue/gray swirl vinyl, full color postcard lyric cards Fronted by Champion's guitarist and owner of Panic Records, Timm McIntosh, Wait In Vain has a rallying voice that has been a part of the uprising, continuation and return of Seattle straight edge hardcore. Lyrically, the band unleashes an intelligent onslaught of messages covering many social and political issues with an emphasis on self-reliance and a need for action toward an uncaring world. For fans of Judge, Trial, Defeater, and Beyond.

name: Ghostlimb - "Bearing and Distance" 12"
description: Sea-foam green vinyl, gatefold jacket Featuring members of Graf Orlock and Dangers, Ghostlimb embrace the more melodic elements of thrashy hardcore for a just-over-20 minute LP that rages elegantly. With "sprinklings of social critique and dissatisfied sarcasm, 'Bearing and Distance' is riddled with succinct aesthetics of the fast, heavy, and tolerably informed." The allegory of seafaring is as rough and complex as the music backing it, making for an overall shipwreck of an album.

name: Restrained/The Separation - s/t split 12"
description: Color choices: Transparent yellow/black vinyl, transparent charcoal vinyl, transparent clear/smoke vinyl; booklet, silk-screened jacket Finally the long awaited split of California's most outspoken, dark, pissed off political hardcore outfits of today. While playing countless local shows and touring consistently they have joined forces. Engineered and Mastered at Earth Capital Studios, this record displays both bands deriving influences from pioneers such as Left For Dead, Catharsis, Integrity and His Hero is Gone. This is their most truthful, heavy and clearest work to date. The record includes a full printed recycled paper booklet with illustrations and other writings along side lyrics and side notes, with an original concept and art by Andrew Gomez IV, this hand crafted packaging comes in a silkscreen recycled cardboard jacket.
